alert.note: Alert for Craig; Mayes; Nowata; Osage; Rogers; Tulsa; Wagoner; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 11 at 12:15AM CDT until April 11 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Craig County in northeastern Oklahoma... Rogers County in northeastern Oklahoma... Southeastern Osage County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northwestern Mayes County in northeastern Oklahoma... Southeastern Washington County in northeastern Oklahoma... Nowata County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northwestern Wagoner County in northeastern Oklahoma... Tulsa County in northeastern Oklahoma... * Until 100 AM CDT. * At 1215 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles east of South Coffeyville to 2 miles west of Talala to 3 miles east of Keystone State Park, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Sand Springs... Claremore... Vinita... Nowata... Pryor... Owasso... Bixby... Jenks... Coweta... Pryor Creek... Skiatook... Catoosa... Collinsville... Verdigris... Chelsea... Inola... Sperry... Oologah... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 216 and 289. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Craig; Mayes; Nowata; Osage; Rogers; Tulsa; Wagoner; Washington
